fields.description:
1. Create a filter with numeric qualifiers.  My example is "All Global Live Jira Issues updated in the last 7 days" where I exclude test projects: project not in ("Test Greenhopper Scrum Project", "Test Software Development", "Test Task Management") and updatedDate >= -7d
2. Save the filter, create a pie chart or two dimensional filter on the dashboard that uses this filter.
3. Click on one of the Pie chart slices, e.g. if using Statistic: Project, pick one

Expected:
You are taken to the 'Issues' page with the additional filter added to give you the results of the Pie chart slice

Actual:
You see the message: Forbidden
You don't have permission to access /secure/IssueNavigator.jspa on this server.
fields.summary: "Forbidden" error showing up when Gadets use filter with numeric qualifiers

fields.description:
We are lost connection to jira. All our user authenticate via LDAP (no local users).
How we can add local user via linux bash?
How we can change LDAP settings via linux shell?
fields.summary: Sorry, an error occurred trying to log you in - please try again.
Advanced filter not properly displayed
"active" field is ignored, when creating a user via JSON importer
Project Administration pages don't load when Project Key contains only numbers

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1.	Search …
Sample query: "project = JRA  ORDER BY created DESC, reporter ASC, key DESC"
2.	Go to page 2 or 3 or any other except 1
3.	Navigation Path:  Tools | Current Page

Observe Problem:
Instead of being presented with the records from the current page, the user is presented with the issues on page one.
fields.summary: Bulk change on 'Current Page' very often only points to the first page of the search filter results
Scale labels in heatmap according to storypoints
The display of AND/OR operator on conditions of transitions is wrong

fields.description:
Hi
I want to reduce the notifications sent by Jira.
Indeed my email provider does not want messages sent exceeds a quota.
We send nearly 5,000 notifications per day, you have a solution to reduce this number.
When my provider blocks all system notifications are stuck in the queue.
The provider considers that a certain number, it is spam being sent
What can be done?
Regards
fields.summary: Reduce notification sent by Jira

fields.description:
The user interface of the advanced search is kind of messed up.

Instead of a long text line we are now limited to a 17 char text box which breaks line and expressions.

Was this done on purpose (I hope not) or is it a glitch you are aware of and working to resolve.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Advanced search user interface

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a Saved Filter so that defects are listed out
2. Click on the Create Issue Link
3. The Pop-up Appears but the Filter Box which should be underneath also comes in front and creates a problem in selecting the issue type and summary etc.

Please find the attached snapshot.
fields.summary: Filter Box Appears In front When New Defect is Raised
As a User I'd like to be able to add Comments from the top of the page rather than scroll down
Atlassian products alphabetical sort are case sensitive
Allow for converting of Select List Custom Fields to Multi Select and vice versa

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* Attempting to drag the order of the Linked Issues column does not work.
* The column will vanish if any changes are made to the column order.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access the Issue Navigator.
# Add the Linked Issues Column.
# Attempt to drag it to another column.

h3. Expected Results

It can be dragged and have its order changed.

h3. Actual Results

It cannot, and any other changes to columns cause it to vanish.

h3. Notes

Cannot reproduce in 5.2.11.
fields.summary: Linked Issues column in the Issue Navigator can't be dragged and vanishes

fields.description:
XML restore for certain DBs seems to fail. It works without issue on PostgreSQL.

No parentheeses on Group Object Filter setting in User Directory throws misleading error
Create method to preserve Issue Links when federating JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35540].
  {panel}

When rendering page - for example https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa - Chrome browser (reproducable also in FF) makes some requests to ifr resources, then it cancels it and makes them again. Example in attached screenshot (request marked in red are cancelled, and then repeated)

This behavior causes delay in rendering and also generates load on server side causing performance problems

This happens on my internal jira, but can be also reproduced in public https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa instance (user not logged in).

It looks like every "filter results" causes one cancelled and one successful request.
fields.summary: browser creates multiple request to ifr (for same resources)
Unable to switch between preview/list view in search page
Make the order of JIRA issue actions selective "on the fly"
Filter UI issue

fields.description:
*Steps To Reproduce*

* Created Issue TEST-1 with default JIRA workflow and schemes, performed some transitions:
* Selecting workflow ID to see which workflow is the issue assigned to:

{noformat}
jira5210=# select workflow_id from jiraissue where pkey = 'TEST-1';
 workflow_id 
-------------
       10000
(1 row)
{noformat}

* Select the workflow ID to extract the historysteps:

{noformat}
select * from os_historystep where entry_id = '10000';

  id   | entry_id | step_id | action_id | owner |         start_date         | due_date |        finish_date         |  status  | caller 
-------+----------+---------+-----------+-------+----------------------------+----------+----------------------------+----------+--------
 10101 |    10000 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:02.971+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:03.791+08 | Finished | admin
 10100 |    10000 |       3 |       301 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:01.824+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:02.965+08 | Finished | admin
 10000 |    10000 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-24 12:29:36.385+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:01.821+08 | Finished | admin
{noformat}

* Now switch to copy of JIRA workflow and different scheme
* Cross check the old workflow ID

{noformat}
select * from os_historystep where entry_id = '10000';

  id   | entry_id | step_id | action_id | owner |         start_date         | due_date |        finish_date         |  status  | caller 
-------+----------+---------+-----------+-------+----------------------------+----------+----------------------------+----------+--------
 10102 |    10000 |       3 |         0 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:03.796+08 |          |                            | Underway | 
 10101 |    10000 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:02.971+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:03.791+08 | Finished | admin
 10100 |    10000 |       3 |       301 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:01.824+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:02.965+08 | Finished | admin
 10000 |    10000 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-24 12:29:36.385+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:01.821+08 | Finished | admin
(4 rows)
{noformat}

* Correct as it populate the last step from the workflow.
* Now check the workflow ID where the issue is assigned to

{noformat}
jira5210=# select workflow_id from jiraissue where pkey = 'TEST-1';
 workflow_id 
-------------
       10100
(1 row)
{noformat}

* Correct as it has migrated to new workflow scheme
* Performed some transition on the issue
* Check on database level again with the new workflow ID

{noformat}
select * from os_historystep where entry_id = '10100';

  id   | entry_id | step_id | action_id | owner |         start_date         | due_date |        finish_date         |  status  | caller 
-------+----------+---------+-----------+-------+----------------------------+----------+----------------------------+----------+--------
 10110 |    10100 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-28 23:31:04.389+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:31:05.093+08 | Finished | admin
 10109 |    10100 |       3 |       301 |       | 2013-10-28 23:31:03.626+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:31:04.386+08 | Finished | admin
 10108 |    10100 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-28 23:31:02.478+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:31:03.621+08 | Finished | admin
 10107 |    10100 |       3 |       301 |       | 2013-10-28 23:26:02.643+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:31:02.473+08 | Finished | admin
 10106 |    10100 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-28 23:26:01.937+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:26:02.64+08  | Finished | admin
 10105 |    10100 |       3 |       301 |       | 2013-10-28 23:26:01.249+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:26:01.933+08 | Finished | admin
 10104 |    10100 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-28 23:26:00.756+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:26:01.244+08 | Finished | admin
 10103 |    10100 |       3 |       301 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:03.796+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:26:00.751+08 | Finished | admin
(8 rows)
{noformat}

* Delete issue TEST-1
* Check database again:

{noformat}
jira5210=# select * from os_historystep where entry_id = '10100';
 id | entry_id | step_id | action_id | owner | start_date | due_date | finish_date | status | caller 
----+----------+---------+-----------+-------+------------+----------+-------------+--------+--------
(0 rows)
{noformat}

* Correct as the history has been removed.
* How about the last entry from last workflow?

{noformat}
select * from os_historystep where entry_id = '10000';

  id   | entry_id | step_id | action_id | owner |         start_date         | due_date |        finish_date         |  status  | caller 
-------+----------+---------+-----------+-------+----------------------------+----------+----------------------------+----------+--------
 10102 |    10000 |       3 |         0 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:03.796+08 |          |                            | Underway | 
 10101 |    10000 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:02.971+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:03.791+08 | Finished | admin
 10100 |    10000 |       3 |       301 |       | 2013-10-28 23:22:01.824+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:02.965+08 | Finished | admin
 10000 |    10000 |       1 |         4 |       | 2013-10-24 12:29:36.385+08 |          | 2013-10-28 23:22:01.821+08 | Finished | admin
(4 rows)
{noformat}

* Wrong, issue is being removed but it still holds in database
fields.summary: Deleting Issue Does Not Remove All Entries from OS_HISTORYSTEP from Previous Workflow
make project planning easier
Make inline editing retrieve latest state of issue from server
How to add an event handler for project version edits?

fields.description:
My Virtual machine where down for some reason; after contacting my admin to reset it or something, Jira failed to launch with the following error

The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started:
Gadget Directory Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.directory)

Can you please tell me the reason for this error and how to fix it.
fields.summary: Jira startup failed

fields.description:
After opening a hyperlink from an email, it refers to a different URL address. For example: 

h4.Expected Result:
http://localhost:8082/browse/TEST-1

h4.Actual Result:
http://browse/TEST-1

Based on the findings, I get two notifications. The one that is containing user mention in the email is the one showing the incorrect URL.

After testing further on my freshly installed instance, it seems that the problem is as followed:

*JIRA 5.0.7*
!mention_you_5.0.7.JPG|thumbnail!

*JIRA 5.2*
!mention_you_5.2.JPG|thumbnail!

When I tested in JIRA 6.1, I can't see the URL linking.
!mention_you_6.1.JPG|thumbnail!

h4.Steps to reproduce the problem:
# search for the issue key (TEST-1)
-Click on "Add Comment" button.
-Typed @
- Choose an user [john(hotmailckl@gmail.com)]
- The comment is now simply a row with {noformat}[~john]{noformat}
-Inputted TEST-1 (in uppercase, because in lower case nothing happens neither wrong nor right)
# Clicked on Add

h4.Finding:
The hyperlink in JIRA 6.1 is obsoleted.
fields.summary: Hyperlink issue key show in email refer to different URL address
Add Internet Explorer 11 as a Supported Platform
Add UI toggle for "can rename user even with JIRA as a Crowd Server" advanced setting
List View for JIRA issue navigator is hidden in the GUI and can only be changed via keyboard
Advanced JQL search box is compacted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35518].
  {panel}

Right now, I can only list my favourite issues through the REST API (i.e. {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}}).

I would like to have access to all of the filters:
* List all the personal filters
* List all the visible filters
* Search filter by keyword
fields.summary: As an Atlassian Connect developer, I would like to query all the filters through the REST API
Rewrite documentation
New feature: Pareto diagrams for issue type usage
New feature: Warn me when removing required fields from a screen
Feature request: Screen compare function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35511].
  {panel}

I am creating a two dimensional filter on a dashboard, but the "status" field is not showing up as a link. The linking is something that we've come to rely on (since it allows all issues in a row/column to be summarized rather than clicking on every column).
The existing two dimensional filters are also broken, but only for the "status" field. The other field values that we use as X and Y axes continue to link to a summary of the row/column.

I am using JIRA/Atlassian OnDemand.

To reproduce:
# I created a new Two Dimensional Filter and selected an existing filter. The filter I chose contains all issues assigned to me from a single project.
# I selected "Issue Type" for my X axis value, and "Status" for YAxis.
# I clicked the Save button and observed that the status column headers did not appear as links nor could I click on them. I can, however, click on the Issue type column as a link.

I attached a screenshot of the table I see created.
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter does not create a link to "status" field
Quick Search box overlaps Create issue button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35509].
  {panel}

Apologies if this is a dupe, I had a look and couldn't find a similar request.

It would be great to add a new feature to "Edit and Share Dashboard", where you could select users or groups of users who can then edit the same dashboard.

We share dashboards across teams in our company. Most of our dashboards are public for anyone in the company to add.
Development Managers add dashboards that PMs create, and would often like to add gadgets, but cannot due to the current limitations.

Let me know if anything isn't clear.

Thanks
fields.summary: Allow multiple users to edit shared dashboards
Confluence Page Gadget page/space select autocomplete control redirects to the item instead of selecting it
Allow direct changes to issues on Issue Navigator

fields.description:
http://www.tempoplugin.com/faq/why-is-there-a-time-difference-between-my-jira-worklog-and-my-tempo-work-log/

From Tempo "The issue is that your profile is set on a different Time Zone (TZ) than is set on the JIRA server, combined with the fact that there is a difference between how Tempo and JIRA handle work dates. Tempo does not convert the date and time you enter to your server TZ before saving it to the database; JIRA does.  When work is logged with Tempo, JIRA’s worklog tab converts the worklog dates “back” to the user TZ with those results."

My company uses Tempo, as we find the timesheets very handy for seeing what team members need to log their time, and where each team spent their time each week.

Our JIRA is hosted in UTC-4, we have offices in UTC-8, UTC and UTC+8, so we are noticing that our Burndown charts and other reports are not accurate due to the way Tempo logs time.

Tempo have stated (on the link above) "Unfortunately we have not had much luck with Atlassian on this matter. We are still pushing it, and hope to resolve this soon."

I can't find any JIRA-XXXXX task or bug to reflect this so I would like to raised this as a customer, as it has been as issue for almost a year now from what I can see - we are not receiving clear feedback from Tempo on this.

Please let me know if I should raise this elsewhere.
fields.summary: Time difference between JIRA worklog and Tempo worklog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35502].
  {panel}

When first searching with a query such as the following:
status changed to "To Do" during (startofweek("+1d"), endofweek("+1d"))
you will receive correct results. Saving this filter, and recalling it again from the Issue Navigator (ie, via the Favorite Filters tab) will strip the double quotes, JIRA will load the following JQL and fail as the + is a protected character:
status changed to "To Do" during (startofweek(+1d), endofweek(+1d))
This means the saved filter cannot be used in Gadgets or be recalled again.
fields.summary: JQL removes double quotes (") from startOfTheWeek("+xd") and other functions

fields.description:
h4. Summary

The action icon (gear, cogwheel) is missing for one or more users after upgrading to JIRA 6.1 and higher.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Bring up a JIRA 6.0.x instance
# Access the issue navigator in (List view) and click on _Tools_ -> _Configure Columns_
# Disable 'Actions' column
# Stop JIRA and upgrade to 6.1.x

h4. Expected result
Should be able to re-enable the 'Actions' column in the new Column menu (issue navigator)

h4. Actual result
JIRA 6.1.x removes the _Configure Columns_ option from the _Tools_ menu, and makes it impossible to restore 

h4. Workaround
# Backup the JIRA database.
# Stop JIRA.
# Run the below update query on the database:
{code}
UPDATE propertynumber
SET propertyvalue = 1
FROM propertyentry
WHERE property_key='user.show.actions.in.navigator'
AND propertyentry.id = propertynumber.id
{code}
# Start JIRA.
# Test! If there's any problems, restore the backup.
fields.summary: Can't Enable Issue Action Column after Upgrade to 6.1.x

fields.description:
After performing a JIRA upgrade from 5.2 to 6.1, many users data got modified:
* *Username* is kept the same
* *Full Name* was cleared and replaced by the *UserName* value
* *Email* was cleared

We performed the upgrade on +three different+ test instances, and we had the problem randomly on the three instances.

For example, user1 & user2 both exist on two different instances running on v5.2 - the users were created manually and inhertited from LDAP. These two instances were copied to two TEST environments on v5.2. These TEST instances were upgraded to v6.1.
user1 is OK on one TEST instance but is messed up on the second.
user2 is messed up on both TEST instances.

We can have a user3 who is OK on both TEST instances

+*Screenshots on the messed up user (_me_):*+

* On JIRA 5.2:
!JIRA_5.2_User.png!

* On JIRA 6.1:
!JIRA_6.1_User.png!
fields.summary: [User Management] Upgrading to 6.1 clears user Emails and replaces Full Name with UserName

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35476].
  {panel}

When running JIRA Attach Screenshot with latest JAVA 7 update 45, user will see a section of security message in the dialog: _This application will be blocked in a future Java security update because the JAR file manifest does not contain the Permissions attribute. Please contact the Publisher for more information._

Additionally, it may display a SecurityException, causing the screenshot functionality to fail.

h5. Steps to Reproduce:
# Update a client machine JAVA to JAVA 7 update 45
# Access JIRA and perform the "Attach Screenshot" operation
# The security message will shown in the dialog:
!JAVA+warning.png|thumbnail!

Note: Only reproduce in JAVA 7 update 45 which related to the [Permission Attribute added|https://blogs.oracle.com/java/entry/java_se_7_update_45] in latest update.

h5. Resolution

This has been fixed in JIRA 6.1.7, and will also be included in JIRA 6.2.

h5. Workaround

The following workaround is available for customers on older versions of JIRA as an interim measure until an upgrade is performed:

# Download the attached screenshot.jar file.
# Replace the existing file in {{<jira-install>/atlassian-jira/secure/applet}}.
# Restart JIRA.

*Important*: Please make sure to test these changes in a staging/test environment before doing it in the production system. 

We have internally tested the workaround against JIRA 4.4.5, 5.0.7,5.1.8,5.2.11,6.0.8, 6.1.6 and no problems observed.
_Please note that under jira 4.x The screenshot applet window will not close upon attaching the issue due to a javascript error. You can close the window manually once you have checked that the screenshot has been attached successfully._
fields.summary: Security Dialog in Screenshot Applet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35469].
  {panel}

Edit: Sorry, the previous description was technically incorrect. I have updated this with a better one.
---------------------------------

Currently the user name picker only matches the beginning letters of a whole word. For example, you can find "John Smith" by typing "Jo" or "Sm", but not "th" even though "th" is a part of "Smith". This is not a problem with Western names.

This, however, doesn't work well with East Asian names (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) in which the family name and given name are not separated by spaces. For example, if there's a person with family name "张" and given name "无忌", the full name appears as "张无忌". Now you can't find this person in the user name picker by just typing his given name "无忌". You must type "张" to find him.

As a workaround, we have to add a white space into the user name and make it look like "张 无忌". This makes it searchable, but is against the language. The extra white space also looks really weird when appearing in sentences which doesn't have word separators at all.
fields.summary: User picker not friendly with East Asian names

fields.description:
*Summary*
The change in assignee field is not recorded when a form with with an empty mandatory field is submitted. So, when the user fills in the empty field and re-submit the form, the assignee does not change. 

This happens to JIRA with default workflow and permissions. 

*Steps to reproduce*
# Make another field Required in Field Configuration. Let's say the Log Work field. 
# Create a new issue and assign it to any user.
# Perform a transition (resolve or close issue);
#* Change the assignee
#* Leave the Log Work field empty
# Submit the form. 
# User will be prompted with error message that the Log Work field is required. Also, user will see that the assignee is the changed assignee. 
# Fill in the Log Work field and submit the form. Now the assignee will remain as the previous one. 

*Expected Behavior*
The assignee change when the form is successfully submitted

*Additional Information*
* When you are prompted with the message saying there is one Required field incomplete, click the submit button again. Now the assignee is changed back to the original one. 
* This behavior does not occur during issue creation. Only with workflow transition after that.
* Doe not happen if user choose Unassigned as assignee

*Screencast*
http://screencast.com/t/sBbVnaHr
fields.summary: Assignee field does not change when form is submitted with an empty mandatory field

fields.description:
There are some inconsistencies to the implementation of the term "Add-Ons" in the JIRA's administration section. Whenever there is a new add-on installed into the instance that requires a reindex (JIRA Agile, for example), the reindex banner will be shown.

However, notice that the banner has the String "Plugins" instead of "Add-Ons":
!plugins-admin.png!

Whereas the instance has the term "Add-Ons" everywhere else:
!addons-admin.png!

I noticed a reported issue JRA-31257 (raised by [~matt.doar]) which addressed this fix in JIRA 6.0; however, seems that this issue is still prevalent.
fields.summary: Plugins - Add-Ons Inconsistencies in Administration Page on reindex required information message

fields.description:
When creating an issue with the "create another" checkbox, the Description field is now cleared for the next issue.  This is not intuitive and goes against the original intent of the "Create Another" checkbox.  It was to be able to persist the fields between issue creations so that the user can change each field as necessary and if needed.  One of the most important fields is the description field because you may take a large amount of time to correctly format an issue's description with intent to re-use it.  Then you may only want to change certain aspects of the description to match your following issue.

On the other hand, if you want to clear the entire description and start over, it takes very little effort (CTRL+A then hit Delete).  So, the amount of effort needed to clear a description is far less than the effort needed to even re-type a single line of a description between issues.

This field should be persistent between issue creations when using the "Create Another" checkbox.
fields.summary: When creating a bug and "create another is checked" the description field is cleared when creating the issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35458].
  {panel}

Just as the summary suggests. It would be great if we could merge accounts and change usernames.

Here is why we need this:
Accounts are added and removed all the time. It would be great to merge accounts so that the data ownership belongs to person that is active.

Username changes happen all the time, especially when people get married.

We are currently migrating several users from ldap to active directory. Unfortunately we have to de-activate there ldap account and create a brandnew account for active directory. This becomes really messy, since we have several deactivated accounts where the user is active in another account. It would be nice if we can merge accounts.
fields.summary: Merge accounts and change usernames.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35457].
  {panel}

Jira should provide the ability to store the attachments in the database.

- Avoid limitations when using file storage systems
- Allow for better backup strategies to be used

Confluence has this feature and it seems inconsistent not to have make this available in Jira.

Note: This issue has been opened after JRA-806 has been marked as Wont Fix with seemingly no explanation. Please re-visit this issue and if it really can't be included, please at least give us some feedback as to why.

There seems to be many users still asking for a long time now.
fields.summary: Abiltiy to store attachments in a databae

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35456].
  {panel}

Hi,

by the procedure we set mail handler - default:

port: 995
usessl: SSL (POP/S)
popserver: POP3 mailbox
handler.params: project=MOBILET,issuetype=1,splitregex=/(/-+\s*Original Message\s\*+-/)|(_____)|(Description:)|(From:.*)/?
forwardEmail: banksoft@bks.hr
handler: Regex Comment Handler

We put in file outlook.email-translations "Description:" see below:
---- Original Message ----
Description:
---- UrsprĂĽngliche Nachricht ----
Description:

Problem with Regex because it doesn't strip old data after "Description", so we have all mail data in system.

Our wish is to have only comment.

What can be the problem?
fields.summary: Regex Comment Handler - creating comment from Outlook

fields.description:

When using the filter statistics gadget and setting the field *Status* as the statistic type, it was possible to click on each of the status and this would perform a search on the issue navigator for the issues that were on that particular status:

!ondemand_old_version.png!

On the latest release, the statuses are no longer links:

!ondemand_new_version.png!

This only happens on OnDemand platform, JIRA 6.1.1 is working fine:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35449].
  {panel}

When I try to translate the descriptions of my custom fields I'm getting into a conflict with the description in the field configurations for those custom fields.

If I clear the description in the field configuration it refills automatically with the translation of the custom field (in the language of the the current admin user profile).

If I now change my profile language the translation of the Custom Field itself works fine. But the translation of the custom field description does not work. It is overwritten by the description of the field configuration (which before had been automatically refilled with the translation of the other language).

{panel}
h4. Findings
The description for custom field does not translate if you are upgrading from previous version of JIRA. Any newly created custom field will have the description translated properly. 

h5. Test case:
# Create a custom field on JIRA 4.2.1 and add description.
# Upgrade to JIRA 6.1.4 (note that translation of custom field was introduced in JIRA 6. See [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TRANS-69?focusedCommentId=473485&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-473485]
# Translate the custom field prior to the upgrade, assume it's Japanese
# Change Default Language to Japanese. (result: description of the custom field will not be translated)
# As a comparison, create a new custom field after the upgrade and perform step 3 & 4. You will now see that the description is translated as well
{panel}
fields.summary: Translation of Custom Field Description
User Preferences Default outgoing email format is not applied.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35447].
  {panel}

If you move issues from one project to another by using bulk change, jira will drop all custom field values that are not enabled for the target project and issue type without warning the user about it.

The best it would be if the custom field values would be kept, even if they are not enabled for the target issue type, so when the jira admin will re-enable them the data will still be there.

Another alternative, which could be harder to implement, is to warn about this before doing this, so the admin has the opportunity to enable these fields before loosing the data.

I am marking this as Critical because data is lost without any warnings.
fields.summary: Bulk Moving Issues could drop custom field data without warning

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35444].
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 18th September 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms and your suggestions here are no different because they let us know how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

I am happy to share that we have shipped Azure SQL Server support in *Jira 7.5* is for both *Jira Server* and *Jira Data Center.*

Thank you for your patience and continuing to provide feedback. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Regards,
Steve King
sking (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA
{panel} 

It would be nice to have SQL Azure as [supported platform|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] for JIRA.
fields.summary: Support for SQL Azure

fields.description:
I have tried adding a webhook as a post function of my workflow in Jira to trigger a bamboo build on certain transitions. But when the transition is passed, the build is not triggered.

I get the following errors within my Jira logs :
#1 java.nio.charset.MalformedInputException: Input length = 1

#2 webhooks-http-retriever:thread-3 WARN      [webhooks.util.http.Cac
hingHttpContentRetriever] Unable to post information to 'http://christophe:6990/bamboo/rest/api/latest/queue/TST-OCBP' a
s user 'null' due to: Input length = 1

If I test the url in a REST client, it will not pass until I specify at least  Content-Type and sometimes a payload, be it empty (for example content-type/xml does not need a payload, content-type/json needs one)

To replicate the problem :
#1 Create a webhook with url : http://bamboo.server/rest/api/latest/queue/PLAN-KEY, deactivate all events
#2 Add web hook as a post function of a transition
#3 update issue so as to pass the transition
fields.summary: Error when trying to trigger bamboo build from Jira webhook

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35436].
  {panel}

If a catch email is specified as part of a group address (http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt section A.1.3) JIRA does not parse it.

Three scenarios exist here:

# Catch email exists before the group:
{code}To: "John Smith" <catchemail@example.com>,
        Web Support: "Web Support minor" <minorsupport@example.com>,
        "WebSupport Major" <majorsupport@example.com>;{code} 
# Catch email exists after the group: 
{code}To: Web Support: "Web Support minor" <minorsupport@example.com>,
        "WebSupport Major" <majorsupport@example.com>;,
        "John Smith" <catchemail@example.com>{code}
# Catch email exists within the group: 
{code}To: Web Support: "Web Support minor" <minorsupport@example.com>,
        "WebSupport Major" <majorsupport@example.com>,
        "John Smith" <catchemail@example.com>;{code}

Scenarios 1 and 2 result in a properly parsed email.
Scenario 3 results in a "do not match the catch email" error.

Expected: Scenario 3 should be parsed without issue.

Steps to repro:

# Download the ingroup.eml file and place it within the <JIRA HOME>/import/mail folder
# Add a new mail handler, and specify the local directory instead of a POP/IMAP server
# Specify the catch email to be: {code}catchemail@example.com{code}
# Set a default assignee, and test the connection, click on More Details
# Error is: {code}Found 1 message(s) in the <JIRA HOME>/import/mail folder.
Cannot handle message as the recipient(s) (Web Support: "Web Support minor" <minorsupport@example.com>, "WebSupport Major" <majorsupport@example.com>, "John Smith" <catchemail@example.com>;) do not match the catch email catchemail@example.com{code}
fields.summary: JIRA's mail handler does not properly parse group email addresses
Allow editing of a workflow via "Import XML"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35434].
  {panel}

I added a post function for hipchat notification, then got this message:

Error in Notify Hipchat configuration for project XXXX (SK). Please contact your administrator to make sure that Notify Hipchat post-function is the last in the list.

I had to click on the down arrow 7 times to get it to the bottom of the list, and didn't see an easier way to move it around.  Would be nice if they could be reordered more simply or allow the user to enter the position in the list.

Best case would be to automatically optimize the order.  In this case, the error indicates that you know what the problem is, so might be possible to just correct it.
fields.summary: Would like ability to quickly or automatically reorder post-functions
